supporting_spans: under cover of the night. But since Glenarvan's conversation with the chief, it seemed wise to abandon this design.
They must be patient. It was the most prudent plan.
reasoning: Contradiction (factual): The evidence directly contradicts the claim that Kai-Koumou trained twelve English-speaking youths as spies and sent them into Auckland. The evidence shows that Kai-Koumou's tribe had recently fought against the English troops, and they were not interested in spying on them.

analysis.claim_text: He trained twelve English-speaking youths as spies, sent them into Auckland; two became servants who secretly watched Glenarvan.

sub_claims.text: He trained twelve English-speaking youths as spies.
Two became servants who secretly watched Glenarvan.
